name: Women Lead the Way
title: High Percentage of Female Top Managers
description: In 2016, 64.8% of firms in Thailand had female top managers, showcasing the country's commitment to gender equality in leadership roles.

name: Social Safety Net Champions
title: High Adequacy of Social Insurance Programs
description: In 2021, Thailand's social insurance programs covered 92.99% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, reflecting a robust social safety net.

name: Healthcare Without Financial Burden
title: Minimal Poverty from Health Expenditure
description: In 2021, only 0.01% of Thailand's population was pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses, indicating effective healthcare policies.

name: Urban Births Fully Registered
title: Complete Urban Birth Registration
description: By 2019, Thailand achieved 100% completeness in urban birth registration, ensuring every urban-born child is officially recognized.

name: Minimal Tariff Complexity
title: Low Specific Tariff Rates on Manufactured Goods
description: In 2015, only 0.00045% of Thailand's tariff lines on manufactured products had specific rates, simplifying trade regulations.

name: UNIDO Funding Deficit
title: Negative Net Official Flows from UNIDO
description: In 2020, Thailand experienced a net outflow of $2,096.82 from UNIDO, highlighting a potential area for improvement in international funding relations.

name: Balancing Domestic Duties
title: High Female Unpaid Domestic Work
description: In 2015, Thai women spent 11.04% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, indicating a need for more balanced domestic responsibilities.
